primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Seeking God' (Jesus) initiates a movement toward the human heart, knocking and calling to overcome human isolation/sin and establish a shared meal (communion).

tekstueel_bewijs: I stand at the door and knock
I will come in to him
will sup with him, and he with me
I will give you my peace

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The 'I Am' of Horeb
tekstueel_bewijs: This passage in Revelation completes who God is in history
addressed to those who have not accepted Christ

helper.identificatie: The Preacher's voice / Biblical Prophecy / The 'I Am' titles
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the end of the prophets knocking at your door

tegenstander.identificatie: Human apathy, 'sealed rooms', and the misconception of a 'hidden God'
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the hearer's own lack of belief or 'closed doors' rather than a cosmic enemy like Death or the Devil.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The search for male role models in the black community.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Young people / Black community
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'Father's Day' section acts as a sociological parenthesis that momentarily shifts the Subject from God to the Hearer seeking a human model.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Eternal 'I Am' → Communion/Peace → The Hearer

voorbeelden_god_subject: I stand at the door and knock

voorbeelden: we must seek the Lord (cited as a former error)
if you believed it... there would be such excitement
Do you know who it is who's knocking?
I will give you my power

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of Jesus to change the situation once the door is open, emphasizing his competence over human incompetence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Seeking' (~S2) and 'Absence' (S2) of the past toward the 'Presence' (S1) of the knocking Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Startling Reversal': God is the seeker, not man.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; the 'absent God' is treated as a theological misconception rather than a terrifying reality of judgment.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is overwhelmingly theocentric in its primary narrative program, making Jesus the initiator and the active subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: find some male model... I looked at those men... as role models

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: nowhere except in the Bible do we get the idea of a seeking God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Deacons and male figures are presented as necessary models for growth.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the only true 'Father' or 'Model' who provides the identity the absent father cannot.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and invitation; the burden of 'seeking' is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: High coherence in the Christological section, but the Father's Day section creates a narrative 'hiccup' where the Subject briefly shifts to human effort.
spanning_punten: The shift from 'God seeking us' to 'You finding a male model'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I will come in to him and will sup with him

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' (power) directly to Jesus rather than the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'confusion', 'weakness', and 'darkness'—deficiencies that need Christ's presence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Christ as the Subject of the 'Seeking' and 'Saving' verbs, effectively dismantling a works-based 'seeking' theology.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The 'Father's Day' section makes the young person the Subject of 'finding' a model.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Position Christ as the 'Model' or 'Father' who finds the fatherless.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Find yourselves some models,' use 'Christ comes to be the Father the world denied you.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the hearer as the one who hears and receives.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong on Pouvoir (Power), weak on Devoir (Obligation).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it serves the grace-orientation well.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'opening of the door' more clearly to a gift of the Spirit (Pouvoir) rather than a human decision.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'closed door' is a bit abstract.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe the 'Opponent' (Sin/Death) as a lock that only the Knocker's voice can break.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To avoid the 'decision theology' trap where the human 'opening' becomes a work.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The ethical program (finding models) is disconnected from the soteriological program (Jesus knocking).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Show how Jesus entering the heart (Program 1) provides the 'male model' or 'fatherly presence' needed for growth (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of theocentric preaching that centers on the character of God as the Seeker.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'I Am' litany's pathos, Greimas reveals the structural reversal of the Subject/Object roles in the 'seeking' narrative.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Laodicean context; semiotics explains how the sermon re-functions the 'door' metaphor to shift agency from man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Identified that the 'Father's Day' section is an actantial outlier that briefly reverts to an anthropocentric structure.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Startling Reversal' strategy to move from Law (we must seek) to Grace (He seeks).
